description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners have the guidance, tools and resources for effective advocacy and partnerships on child rights issues with stakeholders.

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Capacity and skills development for social behaviour change
Children, adolescent and youth engagement and participation
Innovation, multi-media content production and dissemination

title.narrative: Eritrea United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Eritrea: Summative Evaluation of the Strategic Partnership Cooperation Framework (SPCF) between the Government of Eritrea and the United Nations 2013-2016 (“Driving towards MDGs”)
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners have the guidance, tools and resources for effective advocacy and partnerships on child rights issues with stakeholders.

description.narrative: The Ministry of Education rolled out a C4D policy and strategy with 90 cross-sectoral stakeholders. UNICEF and South-South cooperation with the Kathmandu School of Management enabled the National Union of Eritrean Youth and Students to establish digital platforms in all zobas and create youth empowerment centres, providing access to 21,186 youth. Scenario-based training on C4D in emergencies for 28 government officials enhanced their capacity and led to a review of key preparedness actions for health- and climate-related emergencies, while C4D activities were used to boost demand for meningitis A vaccination. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of sub-zobas facilitating regular community dialogue with caregivers of children under 5 to improve knowledge, attitudes and practices and address related social/cultural norms on maternal newborn and child health and development

Capacity development strategy under implementation to strengthen and institutionalize C4D skills of government, implementing partners staff at national level and subnational level meets quality standards
Communication and community engagement platforms/ mechanisms supported by UNICEF meet quality standards across development priorities
C4D support for upstream programmme/policy advocacy on priority behaviors and social norms meets quality standards
A comprehensive RMNCAH communication plan (incorporating malaria, pneumonia and diarrhoea, PMTCT, immunisation, polio and child development) is developed, budgeted and implemented
